title: Hollywood: No Land for Nomads
sub_head: Potential Covid patients and homeless Angelenos make way for Oscar celebrants.
body:
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences had to break a few eggs to make an Oscar. Fortunately for those appearing in Sunday’s awards presentation, the unpleasantness occurred outside the camera frame.
Looming over the event was the question of whether it could exceed the high signal-to-actual virtue ratio achieved at March’s Golden Globes awards show. That ceremony occurred shortly after the Los Angeles Times revealed that America’s leading producers of diversity lectures toast themselves with help from a club containing 87 members, not one of whom is black. After the Times report, the Hollywood Foreign Press Association pledged to admit at least 13 black members.
This week’s Oscars turned out to be a worthy sequel to the Golden Globes. On Sunday there was much earnest talk about the entertainment industry’s vital work in the time of Covid, and of course the festivities presented the picture of responsibility.
